summary:
Narrative designer. Game writer. GDC speaker. Community leader. Educator. Scholar.

Narratologist (MA) with passion for innovative projects. Thinks along with the team to design the story best befitting your game. 
Professional focus on world building, emergent narratives, and characterization through dialogue.
My work experience and projects are listed below.

Highlights:
- working as Story Director on an educational science-fiction theme park in Qatar, designed as one big story world full of unending adventures for kids aged 4-14 years old;
- Eloquence: the innovative language puzzle game conceived by me, currently in development. Eloquence was included in the GDC 2019's Experimental Gameplay Workshop, and EGX 2019's Leftfield Collection;
- Concepting, designing, writing, scripting, testing, and bugfixing events/quests for 4X game Age of Wonders 4
- My article on 'emergent narratives' is top result for Google and most popular search engines;

Experience with VR and applied games
Co-founder of the Game Bakery Cooperative
Spoke at GDC 2021 on my worldbuilding approach that combines graph theory, sociology, and literary theory.
Speaks 9 languages
Always seeking interesting collaborations

projects.title: Eloquence
projects.description:
Eloquence is a point and click language puzzle game. You learn to understand and eventually express yourself in a symbol language. The languages found in Eloquence are alive and used by NPCs, so the best way to discover what words or phrases mean, is by testing them on NPCs to find out how they respond.

Eloquence is a highly innovative game that revolves about communication. It aims to show the strength of language, and focuses on the similarities between language use in different cultures.

Eloquence is my original concept, and I've gathered a small team to help me build this project.

It's innovative character has been recognised by others, as is demonstrated by Eloquence's selection for GDC 2019's Experimental Gameplay Workshop, the inclusion in the DGA's Holland Pavilion at 2019's Gamescom, and the selection for the Leftfield Collection at EGX 2019.

Eloquence has received a government subsidy to stimulate the development of the project, which is now used to create a vertical slice of the game. The team is currently seeking additional development fund.

projects.title: Age of Wonders 4
projects.description:
I joined the narrative team for seven months, during which my tasks consisted of:
- Creating events and quests: responsive narrative moments that allow players to craft their custom story experience during sessions. I concepted, designed, wrote, implemented, and tested/bugfixed my own events and those of others in the in-house engine. I was involved in one third of the total amount of events in the game.
- Edited texts, including the story missions, to improve clarity, style, and continuity
- Added 600+ names for leaders, heroes, factions, and cities

projects.title: Hidden Escape: Horror Mystery
projects.description:
Vincell Studios hired me to write their mobile Hidden Object game 'Hidden Escape: Horror Mystery'.
I refined the story concept they had, wrote an interaction flow that detailed when and why every dialogue would occur, advised on the narrative implications of (puzzle and mini game) design decisions, and wrote the dialogue for the entire game.

projects.title: Flagship Store
projects.description:
For Training.Game (formerly Elaunch), I was asked to write interactive narratives for their vocational training game Flagship Store. I was provided with the didactic theory and suggestions for customer interactions, and designed and wrote 5 scenarios for the project.

My responsibilities included:
- design an entertaining cast of characters that could work in any retail franchise
- create an overarching plot of a series of 12 lessons, that retail workers between age 20-45 could identify with and find entertaining
- break down the overarching plot into episodes and flesh out 5 of these episodes.
- design and flesh out engaging and plausible customer interactions that challenge the user's understanding of retail theory in practice for the 5 episodes.
- write concise yet realistic branching dialogue that facilitates various customer service styles, and implement feedback on these styles in the results of the these branches in a natural way
- give input on visual assets that would accompany the branching narratives
- give advice on how to shorten the narratives after discovering that the initial assignment resulted in episodes that were too long for users to enjoy.

A demo build, based on my designs and writing, went on to win a Gold Medal in the International Serious Play Awards (2022) and a Platinum LearnX Award 2022.

projects.title: We Were Here Forever
projects.description:
I was the narrative designer and writer for We Were Here Forever, following a pleasant collaboration with Total Mayhem Games on this title's predecessor: We Were Here Together.

I helped develop the game's plot, added detail, consistency and substance to the game series lore, wrote text for puzzles, wrote all screenplays and dialogue for trailers and cutscenes, and instructed voice actors how to best record their lines.

Almost all trailer text and several in-game texts were written in rhyme and often contain coded or cryptic information that only hardcore fans of the series will discover and appreciate. 

I strongly championed having the plot progress based on the internal motivations of the key (non-player) characters in the story.

I worked closely together with the creative director, team leads, and management.

projects.title: Astron Puzzle Discovery Tours
projects.description:
ASTRON (Netherlands Institute for Radio Astronomy) asked me to write three puzzle tours. The routes of these tours are mapped out around three of their astronomy research sites: the Westerbork telescopes, the historic Dwingeloo telescope, and the world's largest radio telescope: the LOFAR.

ASTRON provided me with the amount of stops that each route would have and gave me access to a trove of information about their organisation, the telescopes, and their discoveries about the universe.

I delivered three stories, told from the perspective of ASTRON employees and volunteers, which show the origin and applications of the various telescopes, but also give insights in how our society benefits from the research. The tours are designed for families, meaning that children are able to understand the information provided by the tours while being entertained, and parents should find the tours highly informative.

projects.title: Horns of Justice
projects.description:
Carnival of Chaos is developing Horns of Justice, a sports-based MOBA with a twist.
For this project, I was asked to design character personalities and backgrounds, write screenplays for cutscene's, write barks for the characters before and during matches, and finally reinforce and expand the existing worldbuilding. The world of Horns of Justice is harsh and unforgiving, and it was crucial for the team's internal goals that this attitude was reflected and consistent in every manifestation of the narrative.

projects.title: Hidden Escape: Murder Mystery
projects.description:
I edited the dialogue for the mobile title Hidden Escape: Murder Mystery by Vincell Studios. 
Vincell Studios had the game fully developed and ready for release, but they were not satisfied with the latest version of the dialogue. My assignment was to make the dialogue snappier and reduce by 25%.

I reduced the amount of lines and words by 27%. I restructured some dialogues to be more efficient while guaranteeing that every line fulfilled at least one of the following requirements:
1. add to the characterisation of the speaking character;
2. instruct the player on what to do next;
3. drive the plot forward

User reviews frequently mention the quality of the dialogue.
Hidden Escape: Murder Mystery was awarded the 2nd best indie game of India 2021

projects.title: VR Industrial Worker Training
projects.description:
I wrote 5 screenplays for a VR work safety training experience for Stark Learning. 
Skilled workers in the heavy industries would play through these experiences to learn about safety risks and regulations. Key to ensuring these screenplays would land well with the target audience was to prioritise the authenticity of the characters and scenarios. The target audience can have difficulty accepting the virtual world, so all elements needed to emulate the actual work environment so allow the workers to become immersed in the experience.

Writing these screenplays included:

- understanding and implementing on-worksite culture and vernacular
- creating a cast of believable characters with easy to understand and recognize interpersonal relations
- writing situations and events that lead to health hazards that are plausible
- showing how failing to adhere to satefy precautious leads to tragedy by focusing on the emotional impact of an accident on the workers and their environment, most notably their family.

projects.title: Persona [Consultancy]
projects.description:
Person Unknown hired me as a consultant to explore how they could effectively use narrative structures and compelling, dynamic characters in their AR training tool Persona.

I studied the material they already had, engaged in an ons-ite discussion with the project lead, and presented my recommendations for the best use of narrative and story for their products.

projects.title: We Were Here Together
Warzone [Consultancy]
projects.description:
For Tiny Tactics, I wrote a recommendation document that enables the studio to bolster the narrative structure for mobile MMORPG Warzone.

The document contained the following recommendations, among others:
- Restructuring suggestions for increased narrative impact
- NPC design guide
- World Building feedback and suggestions
- Guidelines for in-game text

Warzone is available for iOS and Android devices.

projects.title: Mahjong Crimes
AR childrens' picture book: 'Rosie Can't Sleep'
projects.description:
Together with Studio Bleep and Sfinx Games, I am developing a childrens' picture book using Augmented Reality (AR) technology, for the target audience of children aged 3 to 6 years. AR is cleverly combined with beautiful and colourful hand-drawn pictures.

AR enables the reader to make the images jump off the book's pages by using a smartphone or tablet. In fact, it allows for interaction with the illustrations. This way, the book's story can be somewhat influenced, which results in a richer and more interactive reading experience, connecting the best of two types of media. The app will be made freely available in the App Store and Play Store, while the book can be utilised without the app as well.

My task was firstly to compose lines of poetry that emphasise the connection between the pictures in the book and the fantasy world in the app. The story tells of a girl called Rosie, whose stuffed animal Swinger won't go to sleep. Therefore, they explore all the rooms in Rosie's house, each of which turn into adventurous and exciting environments in the fantastic mind of Rosie. The book's illustration portray the house's rooms, while the objects in the rooms transform into interactive play opportunities in the app. The text and tone of the poems need to relate to both the 'realistic' rooms and the imagined objects for this reason. 

Secondly, my task was to link the inherently static nature of a book to the interactivity of the app. The book will always show the same text and images, whereas the app enables readers to create a unique experience out of every reading session. This interconnection caused issues in areas such as interaction, continuity, replay-ability, and branching play experiences. By designing the architecture of the story, texts, and images in a specific manner, I managed to balance all of these factors to achieve an innovative, interactive play and reading experience.

There is a demo available for the picture book as well as the app.

projects.title: D.A.I.N.N.
projects.description:
I design the story and narrative for the game D.A.I.N.N. within a small team. In this game, you play as an interplanetary parcel deliverer. Yet you crash, and will be required to retrieve your crew and scattered parcels, as well as collect food, water and fuel; all of which are scattered over a solar system.

With play-throughs of roughly one hour and a half, each solar system is entirely generated procedurally and at random, thanks to the custom engine that our programmer built from scratch.

The game will contain no letters, numbers or words. The UI will be minimal. Nonetheless, the game wil tell rich narratives. How this works, I cannot disclose at this time. I can only give away for now that I am designing innovative and experimental systems to achieve this. 

More news on this project soon.

projects.title: Neon Knight
projects.description:
I am employed by the studio Alternate Function 4 to write the story of Neon Knight, a game in which you drive your special vehicle through a dystopian, futuristic city. The game's art style has as distinct 1980s vibe, complete with neon colours and synthesiser music.

The core of the narrative design is a traditional story, in which the protagonist is trying to overthrow a dictator with the help of several allies. Some parts of the story may be skipped, or a choice will be available between several optional plot paths, according to the player's preferences.This story is complemented with other narrative clues, that may be collected and will, when correctly sorted, provide additional information on the game's world and characters.

The game is set in a fictive United States city, and contains a cast comprised of culturally diverse characters. My challenge in this project is to have as many characters as possible change with the story, to achieve the feeling that the game world is dynamic and vivid.

projects.title: Skyrim mod: 'The Shire'
projects.description:
When I joined this online community, I was supposed to merely write several in-game books, in order to fill the modified gaming environment of the RPG 'The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim'. The player will find himself in a world based on The Shire (from 'The Lord of the Rings'), and will be able to read many books that will illustrate the history, culture and ideologies of The Shire. 

However, I was soon given the task of designing the mod's Main Quest line, which resulted in a creative approach to the source material in terms of world and lore, in which the player is supposed to be sufficiently empowered to make a difference through his actions. 

This led to a branching story structure, with thresholds for varying side quests (also designed by myself) and at least two distinct climaxes to the story. 

Together with the project manager, I designed story characters and written a character sheet for each of them. I additionally designed the quests and assigned stages to each quest, while also writing the full dialogue for the Main Quest, including all branching dialogue options and selection conditions.

Finally, I acted as editor of dialogue written by others and check these on spelling, tone, and validity within the confines of Middle-Earth's fantasy world.

profile_positions.description:
Please find a list of my projects at the bottom of my profile.

Multiverse Narratives is the name under which I operate as game writer and narrative designer. I live and breathe all things story and narrative. Fortunately, game developers of today look beyond the stereotypical game experiences and seek opportunities to instil their products with inspiring, horrifying or dramatic appeal. 

I'm available as freelancer and prefer to work closely with the developer, to ensure that gameplay and story are intertwined and connected. I am always seeking new opportunities in which to express my creative energy, so you are most welcome to send me a message.

My professional strengths lie in the areas of:
- emergent narratives (my article on emergent narratives has been the top result for Google and other widely-used search engines for years: https://multiverse-narratives.com/2015/05/07/emergent-narratives-in-games/)
- world building (ask me about my method using network theory and sociology to create dynamic worlds full of conflict)
- thrilling dialogue (I make sure players know what characters expects from them, while maintaining a naturally sounding tone of voice)

I am particularly interested in projects that include the following themes:
- mythology and folklore
- cultures and languages
- duality and symmetry
- tension between different levels of knowledge; objective truth versus represented truth
- playing with the player's expectations

profile_positions.description:
I've been elected chairman of the board of the Groningse game developers co-operative: the Game Bakery. 

As chairman, I acted as spokesperson for the co-operative, and occupied myself with the collective's daily opportunities and challenges. Moreover, I oversaw our relocation during the pandmic lockdown, and faciliated a growth in member numbers after the pandemic.

I committed myself to these three topics:
- Achieve more diversity and growth within our collective;
- Make local governments and institutions more familiar with our community and more aware of their activities;
- Finding and finally relocating to a new office space.

I had already made considerable efforts towards establishing an outstanding reputation for the Game Bakery with national and international partners during the years I acted as secretary.

profile_positions.description:
Within the programme of Communication and Multimedia Design, I worked a few months in a different minor. 

In the minor Transmedia Storytelling, students start en run projects that aim to tell one story by using various media together. The target audience is often encouraged or invited to join the storytelling process. I supported students in these projects, using my expertise on story structure and world building.

Many of my tasks involve coaching students and project groups. Together with the student(s), I try to discover what an individual or group needs in their current stage of learning and development. The outcome of this process is then used as a basis to determines their tasks, goals and the advice I offer them.
